1.name: accio
1.pronunciation: Various, including: AK-ee-oh or AK-see-oh , AK-see-oh , AS-see-oh (US), and AT-chee-oh (Anglo-Catholic pronunciation)
1.description: Summons an object towards the caster. It is able to summon objects in direct line of sight of the caster, as well as things out of view, by calling the object aloud after the incantation (unless the spell is casted nonverbally). This spell needs thought behind it, and the object must be clear in the casters mind before trying to summon it. The caster doesn't necessarily need to know the location of the target if they say the name of the object to be summoned, such as when Hermione Granger summoned some books from Dumbledore's office simply by saying "Accio Horcrux books!" while in Gryffindor Tower.

3.name: alarte ascendare
3.description: Shoots the target high into the air.

5.name: alohomora
5.description: Unlocks doors and other objects. It can also unlock doors that have been sealed with a Locking Spell, although it is possible to bewitch doors to become unaffected by this spell.

6.name: amato animo animato animagus
6.description: Spell used as part of the process of becoming an Animagus. The incantation has to be recited at sunrise and sundown, every day before the consumption of the Animagus Potion. The incantation is also recited just prior to the consumption of the potion, which has to take place just after a lightning storm starts. The incantation is recited while placing the wand's tip over one's heart.

7.name: anteoculatia
7.description: Causes the target to grow antlers.

10.name: aparecium
10.description: Reveals secret messages written in invisible ink, or any other hidden markings. Also works against Concealing charms

11.name: appare vestigium
11.description: Reveals traces of magic, including footprints and track marks.

12.name: aqua eructo
12.description: This spell is used to create, and control, a jet of clear water from the tip of the wand; it is probably related to Aguamenti.

14.name: arresto momentum
14.description: Decreases the velocity of a moving target. Can be used on multiple targets, as well as on the caster themselves. It was invented by Daisy Pennifold in 1711 for use on the Quaffle in Quidditch.

15.name: ascendio
15.description: Lifts the caster high into the air. The charm also works underwater, propelling the caster above the surface.

17.name: avifors
17.description: Transforms the target into a bird.

18.name: avenseguim
18.description: Turns an object into a tracking device.

22.name: baubillious
22.description: The exact effects of the spell are unknown, though it presumably is of damaging nature and it produces a bolt of white light from the tip of the wand.

28.name: bombarda maxima
28.description: Creates a large explosion capable of removing entire walls. A more advanced and more powerful form of the Exploding Charm.

34.name: capacious extremis
34.description: Expands the internal dimensions of an object without affecting the external dimensions, enhancing its capacity, and rendering its contents lighter.

35.name: carpe retractum
35.description: Produces a rope of light used to pull objects towards the caster, or, if the target is fixed in place, to pull the caster towards the target.

39.name: cave inimicum
39.description: Produces a boundary that keeps the caster hidden from others.

43.name: colloportus
43.description: Locks doors and all things that can be locked. It is the counter-charm to the Unlocking Spell.

44.name: colloshoo
44.description: Sticks the target's shoes to the ground.

47.name: confundo
47.description: Causes the victim to become confused and befuddled.

51.name: crucio
51.description: Inflicts intense pain on the recipient of the curse. This curse does not physically harm the victim, but may in extreme cases drive them insane. The pain is described as having hot knives being driven into the victim. It cannot be cast successfully by a person who is doing so out of pure spite or anger; one must feel a true desire to cause the victim pain. If one casts this spell, he or she will receive a life sentence in Azkaban prison for it, as with the other two Unforgivable Curses.

52.name: defodio
52.description: Allows the caster to dig and carve through the target.

53.name: deletrius
53.description: Counter-charm to the Reverse Spell, vanishing the image of the last spell cast. It may also disintegrate other certain images.

54.name: densaugeo
54.description: This hex causes the victim's teeth to grow rapidly, but can also be used to restore lost teeth, as proven when Ted Tonks did so in 1997 for Harry Potter.

55.name: deprimo
55.description: Charm used to blast holes in the ground.

56.name: depulso
56.description: Sends the target away from the caster. It is the counter-charm to the Summoning Charm.

57.name: descendo
57.description: Causes object to fall or move downwards.

60.name: diffindo
60.description: Used to precisely cut or tear objects.

64.name: draconifors
64.description: Transforms the target into a dragon.

69.name: engorgio
69.description: Causes the target to swell in physical size. Its counter-charm is the Shrinking Charm.

70.name: engorgio skullus
70.description: Causes the victim's skull to swell disproportionately. This spell may be a variation of the Engorgement Charm, as they share the first word of the incantation. Its countercurse is Redactum Skullus.

72.name: episkey
72.description: Used to heal relatively minor injuries, such as broken bones and cartilage.

73.name: epoximise
73.description: Adheres one object to another, as if they had been glued together.

74.name: erecto
74.description: Used to erect a tent or other upright structure.

76.name: evanesco
76.description: Vanishes the target. Vanished things go "into non-being, which is to say, everything."

77.name: everte statum
77.description: Throws the victim backward, similarly to being thrown.

78.name: expecto patronum
78.description: This charm is a highly powerful and advanced protective spell which will conjure a spirit guardian of their positive emotions to defend against dark creatures; it can also send messages to other witches or wizards. The Patronus takes the form of an animal, unique to each person who casts it. The form of a Patronus can change when one has undergone a period of heightened emotion.

79.name: expelliarmus
79.description: Forces whatever an opponent is holding to fly out of their hand. It was considered to be Harry Potter's signature spell.

80.name: expulso
80.description: Provokes an explosion, unique in that it uses pressure to do so as opposed to heat.

85.name: fianto duri
85.description: A defensive charm which, based on the etymology, strengthens shield spells, and perhaps objects in general, in a similar way to Duro.

90.name: flagrante curse
90.description: Causes objects to burn on contact.

91.name: flagrate
91.description: Writes in midair with firey marks.

98.name: geminio
98.description: Duplicates the target. When used to duplicate objects indefinitely on purpose, is known as the Gemino Curse.

99.name: glacius
99.description: Freezes the target with icy-cold air.

100.name: glacius duo
100.description: A more powerful version of Glacius.

101.name: glacius tria
101.description: A more powerful version of Glacius Duo.

102.name: glisseo
102.description: Causes the steps on a stairway to flatten into a slide.

108.name: homenum revelio
108.description: Reveals human presence in the vicinity of the caster.

118.name: immobulus
118.description: Immobilises and stops the actions of the target. It works both on living and inanimate things.

119.name: imperio
119.description: Places the victim completely under the caster's control. The victim is put into a trance-like state, and becomes very suggestible to the commands of the caster. However, those who are strong willed may learn to resist it. One of the three "Unforgivable Curses," the use of this curse on another human results in capital punishment or life sentence in Azkaban.

121.name: impervius
121.description: Makes an object repel water and mist.

122.name: inanimatus conjurus
122.description: It is a spell of unknown effect, most likely used to conjure an inanimate object.

124.name: incendio tria
124.description: An improvement over both Incendio and Incendio Duo.

125.name: inflatus
125.description: Inflates the target, filling it with air.

126.name: informous
126.description: Informous is a spell that is used to complete one's Folio Bruti. A page with a brief description (including weaknesses and strengths) of the charmed creature is added to the caster's Folio Bruti.

132.name: lapifors
132.description: Transforms the target into a rabbit.

134.name: locomotor
134.description: Allows a witch or wizard to levitate a target a few inches off of the ground and then move said object in any given direction. Similarly to the Summoning Charm, a specific object can be moved by calling the object aloud after saying the incantation.

136.name: lumos
136.description: Illuminates the tip of the caster's wand, allowing the caster to see in the dark.

137.name: lumos duo
137.description: Creates a focused beam of light from the end of the wand. It is a variant of the Wand-Lighting Charm.

138.name: lumos maxima
138.description: Produces a blinding flash of bright white light from the tip of the wand. It is a variant of the Wand-Lighting Charm.

139.name: lumos solem
139.description: Produce a blinding flash of sunlight. It is a variant of the Wand-Lighting Charm.

141.name: mimblewimble
141.description: Ties the target's tongue in a knot, preventing them from making coherent speech, or saying incantations correctly, making it useful in duels.

143.name: mobiliarbus
143.description: Levitates wooden objects a few inches off of the ground and moves them in any given direction.

145.name: molliare
145.description: Produces an invisible cushion over the target, is used primarily in the manufacturing of broomsticks.

147.name: mucus ad nauseam
147.description: Gives the victim a nasty cold and an extremely runny nose that can cause the victim to collapse if it is not treated. The cold is accompanied with constant sneezing.

148.name: muffliato
148.description: Prevents others from hearing nearby conversations by filling peoples' ears with an unidentifiable buzzing.

149.name: multicorfors
149.description: Multicorfors is a charm used to change the colour and style of one's clothing.

150.name: mutatio skullus
150.description: Mutates the victim's head, causing them to grows extra heads.

151.name: nox
151.description: Extinguishes wandlight. It the counter-charm for the Wand-Lighting Charm, Lumos.

152.name: nebulus
152.description: Creates fog from the tip of the wand.

159.name: partis temporus
159.description: Creates a temporary gap in the target.

161.name: periculum
161.description: Produces a burst of red sparks.

163.name: peskipiksi pesternomi
163.description: The one time it was used, it had absolutely no effect.

164.name: petrificus totalus
164.description: Used to temporarily bind the victim's body in a position much like that of a soldier at attention; the victim will usually fall to the ground.

169.name: portus
169.description: Turns an object into a portkey.

170.name: prior incantato
170.description: Forces a wand to show an "echo" of the last spell it performed.

172.name: protego
172.description: Invisible shield that reflects spells and blocks physical entities.

173.name: protego horribilis
173.description: A powerful shield charm against dark magic.

174.name: protego maxima
174.pronunciation: pro-TAY-goh MAX-ee-Ma
174.description: A powerful shield charm against dark magic. A stronger and bigger version of Protego, especially when combined with other wizards casting it at the same time. Was so powerful that it could also disintegrate people that came too close and tried to enter it.

175.name: protego totalum
175.description: Protects an area for an extended period of time.

178.name: quietus
178.description: Makes a target sound quieter. It is the counter-charm to the Amplifying Charm.

179.name: redactum skullus
179.description: Shrinks the head of the target. It is the counter-spell to Engorgio Skullus.

180.name: reducio
180.description: Makes an object shrink in size. Its counter-charm is the Engorgement Charm.

181.name: reducto
181.description: Breaks objects. In stronger usages, disintegrates them.

183.name: reparifors
183.description: Reverts minor magically-induced ailments, such as paralysis and poisoning.

184.name: reverte
184.description: Returns objects to their original positions or states.

185.name: rennervate
185.description: Awakens an unconscious victim. It is consequently the counter-charm to the Stunning Spell.

187.name: repello muggletum
187.description: Keeps Muggles away from wizarding places by causing them to remember important meetings they missed and to cause the Muggles in question to forget what they were doing.

188.name: repello inimicum
188.description: Disintegrates the persons entering this charm.

189.name: revelio
189.description: Reveals secrets about a person or object.

190.name: rictusempra
190.description: Tickles the target until they become weak with laughter.

191.name: riddikulus
191.description: A spell used when fighting a Boggart, "Riddikulus" forces the Boggart to take the appearance of an object the caster is focusing on. Best results can be achieved if the caster is focusing on something humorous, with the desire that laughter will weaken the Boggart.

199.name: sectumsempra
199.description: Lacerates the target, as if they have been "slashed by a sword." Subsequently, the target can easily bleed to death from the wounds. This curse was invented by Severus Snape, to be used against his personal enemies.

204.name: skurge
204.description: Cleans up ectoplasm and frightens ghosts and other spirits.

207.name: sonorus
207.description: Makes the target sound louder. The counter-charm is the Quietening Charm, Quietus.

208.name: specialis revelio
208.description: Reveals spells cast on objects or potions.

210.name: spongify
210.description: Softens objects, making them rubbery and bouncy.

213.name: steleus
213.description: A hex that causes the victim to sneeze for a short period of time. This spell is used in duelling to distract the opponent.

214.name: stupefy
214.description: Stuns the target, rendering them unconscious.

233.name: verdillious
233.description: A spell used to shoot green sparks from the end of the wand.

234.name: verdimillious
234.description: Produces a jet of green sparks that can be used in duelling, or to reveal things hidden by dark magic.

235.name: verdimillious duo
235.description: A more powerful version of Verdimillious.

237.name: vermillious
237.description: Jet of red sparks that can be used to signal an emergency or as a minor duelling spell.

238.name: vulnera sanentur
238.description: Healing spell that slows blood flow, clears residue, and knits wounds. It is the counter-curse to Sectumsempra.

239.name: waddiwasi
239.description: Used to shoot small, soft masses of whatever the caster so desires at the target
